item.title: Lesson 137: O Christmas Tree
item.itunes:author: Radio Television Hong Kong
item.itunes:subtitle: Tai Chi - Prince Edward Fa si cheung - flower market lei seung mai mat yeh? - What do you want to buy? O seung mai seng dan syu - I want to buy a Christmas Tree Lei seung m'seung mai fa? - Do you want to buy flowers? lidi fa hou gwai wo!- these flowers are very expensive! M'gwai - not expensive! ying goi hai ah - I think so Seung tai ha - want to look O tai ha/ tai gan - I'm looking cheui bin tai - look at your leisure chi gei gan - choose for yourself hou heung - smells nice seng dan fa - Poinsetta (Christmas flower) hou gan dan - simple lidi hou leng - these are pretty hou chong - heavy O jungyi seng dan syu heung - I love the smell of Christmas Trees Wui m'wui song - do you deliver? song heui yu geng wan - deliver to Discovery Bay m'sai song - no delivery lok baak - 600 tsuen bou - "Everything in" mou che - no car dap dek si - take a taxi yat sek yi liu - one stone two birds seng dan fa lei yiu m'yiu - do you want a Poinsetta? lido EPSy dak m'dak? - Do you take EPS here? Seun yong ka - credit card

item.title: Lesson 136: Yum Cha Part 2
item.itunes:author: Radio Television Hong Kong
item.itunes:subtitle: Yanwei odei yiga hai yum cha - because we are now having yum cha li jeung toi gei do hou? - What number is this table? yi ling yat A hou toi - table number 201A lei seung sek mat yeh? What do you want to eat? Lei seung m seung sek ha gow? - Do you want to eat shrimp dumplings? cheung fan -"instestine" mai sai - sold out chun gyun - spring rolls tong mai - and also m hou toi o la - don't push me sau seng - shut up! cheng di m'goi - be quiet please jau hoi la! - Go Away! o cheng - I invite (you) (I'm paying) hou sek - good to eat chun gyun hou sek - the spring rolls are good (to eat) ha chun gyun - shrimp spring rolls jyu yok chun gyun - pork spring rolls yanwei hou sekdi - because they are better to eat

item.title: Lesson 135: Love n' hate
item.itunes:author: Radio Television Hong Kong
item.itunes:subtitle: seng dang chit - Christmas seng dang fai lok - Happy Christmas! lei sung m'sung sek mincie pie? would you like (to eat) a mince pie? o hou m'jung yi sek mincie pie - I really don't like (to eat) mince pies tai tim - too sweet tim m'tim ah? - Is it sweet? O oi lei - I love you O jung yi lei - I like/love you M'jung yi - I don't like hahn/chang - hate O chang godi yan - I hate those people O hahn lei - I hate you hou do yan wah - lots of people say o hou jungyi yam beh jau - I like (to drink) beer O hou m'jungyi yam beh jau - I don't like (to drink) beer lei jung m'jungyi sek mincie pie? - Do you like to eat mince pies? yat bin - inside Mincie pie yatbin yao mat yeh? - what's inside a mince pie? seui go gon - dried frui tai chi gon - raisins (dried grapes) lei do hai - you too hou chi lei gam - just like you

M'heui bindo - I'm not going anywhere O lau hai lido - I'm staying here Lau hai heung gong - I'm staying in Hong Kong

item.title: Lesson 132: Vital Cantonese
item.itunes:author: Radio Television Hong Kong
item.itunes:subtitle: Sei gwai jau dim - four seasons hotel jau dim - hotel/wine shop fun yeng lei heung gong - welcome to hong kong lei yao mou jungman meng? Do you have a Chinese name? o meng giu Ah Sin - I'm called Ah Sin Keui meng giu Ah Sa - She's called Ah Sah jungman meng - Chinese name wai dak - strong and virtuous doi m jyu - sorry (I can't face you) m'hou yisi - I'm sorry (less serious) bingo lei ga? - Who is this? item.itunes:subtitle: O'm chi chigei gong mat yeh - I don't know what I'm saying Chigei - self Lei la? - and you? Lei chi m'chi chigei gong mat yeh? - Do you know what you're saying? item.title: Lesson 110: Honolulu
item.itunes:author: Radio Television Hong Kong
item.itunes:subtitle: Lei Hou - Hello Dai ga hou - hello everybody lei hai bindou ah? Where are you? O dei? - We? Odei hai bindo ah? - Where are we? Odei yiga hai tan dou ga fei beng dim - Now we're in the Hawaiian Islands Coffee and Cake Shop (Honolulu coffee shop) Lei jung m'jung yi lidou ah? - Do you like it here? O dou hai - me too Gam lei seung m'seung sek yeh? - So do you want to eat something? Seung - Yes I want (to) O seung yam yit ling sui - I want to drink hot lemon water Lei la? - And you? Yat boi yit ling sui ah, m'goi - one cup of hot lemon water please Lei yau meh bau? - What kind of buns do you have? Bo lo bau - pineapple bun Dahn taat - Egg tart Ganjyu mat yeh? - then what? Tai ji bau - raisin bun Tai ji - grape Tai ji - Prince Edward or Supreme Son Hou m'hou sek? - Is it tasty? (good to eat?) Heui Tai ji sek tai ji - go to Prince Edward to eat grapes Tai bou chi - read the newspaper Ga yau! - Come On! Go! (when shouting for a team) Ying ga lan ga yau! - Go England! Heung gong ga yau! - Go Hong Kong! Jungkok ga yau! - Go China! Tai yeung - the sun Tai Tai - supreme supreme (rich lady who doesn't work) Tai chi gon- raisin (dried grape) Hou suen - very sour Yit ling sui hou m'hou yam? - How's your hot lemon water? Fong mat - (bee) honey Mat fong - honey bee

item.title: Lesson 109: Author
item.itunes:author: Radio Television Hong Kong
item.itunes:subtitle: Hou loi mou gin - Long time no see Gei loi ah? - How long? Leung go lai bai/ seng kei - two weeks do dak - ok tai loi (wo) - too long! O hei mong la! - I hope so! Lei seung go lai bai yi jou mat yeh? - Last Tuesday what were you doing? Bingo ah? - Who? Bindou yan lei? - Where is he from? Au jau yan - Australian O mei teng go - I haven't heard (about that) Se - write Se chi lau - office (write word building) Se syu - write a book jok ga - author Au Jau jok ga - An Australian author Keui se goh meh syu? - Which book has he written? Tau syu lou - "Steal book guy" (Cecilie's translation of The Book Thief!) Seung go lai bai lok - last Saturday Hou do gei wui - lots of opportunities Yu geng wan - Discovery Bay Yu geng wan yau hou do Gweilo (wo) - in Discovery Bay there are lots of expats (ghost man) Hou fan - lots of trouble Ma fan - trouble Yu geng wan hou fan - Discovery Bay is trouble Yat yuet - January Yi yuet - February Sam yuet - March O mm yuet heui Sut-lei - In May I'm going to Sydney O jung yi Wu sin sang - I like Mr Wu O pan mong heui godou - I'm looking forward to going there

item.title: Lesson 108: Shower curtain
item.itunes:author: Radio Television Hong Kong
item.itunes:subtitle: Lei Heui bindo ah?- Where have you been? O heui bindo ah? - Where have I been? O m'heui bindo - I have been nowhere O hei do - I am here O dei hai bindo ah? Where are we? O seung mai yok lim - I want to buy a shower curtain Yok lim - shower curtain Chi boi - paper cup O'm yiu chi boi - I don't want paper cups O'm jung yi - I don't like (them) M hou yam - It doesn't taste good (drinks) M hou mei - Not good taste (food) Mei - taste Ah boi - china (ceramic) cup Lei seung m'seung mai lidi yeh? - Do you want to buy any of these things? Kap - suck Kap yeh - suck things Din geh yeh - electrical things Lei yiu m'yiu ah? Do you want them? O m'yiu - I don't want Lidi - these Jau la - let's go Lidi yeh jungman dim gong ah? - What do you call these in Chinese? Bou - casserole dish Tai gwai - too expensive Yat chin man tai gwai - $1,000 is too expensive Hou gwai - expensive Lipai - recently Lei lipai jou di mat yeh? - Recently what have you been doing? O lipai hou mong - recently I have been busy Gei lok pin - documentary Gei dak - chronicle/remember Lok - record Pin - film Lei gei lok pin dim ah? - How was your documentary? Lei gei lok pin gong mat yeh? - What's your documentary about? Lei gong mat yeh?- What are you about? M'hou gam gong - don't say that! M'hou gam la - don't be like that

item.title: Lesson 107: Taxi
item.itunes:author: Radio Television Hong Kong
item.itunes:subtitle: Sin Sang - Sir/ Mister Lok Hou Ma Tau M'goi - Pier number 6 please Gong mat yeh? - What did you say?/ are you saying? M'sai gong yingman - don't speak English dim ah, lei? - how are you? tong mai - and also gan jyu - and then/ following o gan lei heui... - I am following you to.... o pui lei - I am accompanying you dai yat tsi dap dek si - the first time to take a taxi chek haan - straight ahead/ go along chek heui - (also used for straight ahead but means "go to...") haan - walk o han fan okei - I walked home chuen jou - turn left chuen yau - turn right chin siu siu - a little bit further chin - in front hou sat che - lots of traffic jams O'm seung sei - I don't want to die han mandi ah, m'goi - slow down please fai di - faster M hou keng din wah - don't talk on the phone dou jou la - we're here mei dou - not yet arrived suen - ferries O'm sung jau - I don't want to go O'm sung gong bye bye - I don't want to say goodbye Si daan ah - never mind

item.title: Lesson 106: Wanchai
item.itunes:author: Radio Television Hong Kong
item.itunes:subtitle: Lei yao mou chin - do you have any money? Lido yao hou dou yan - there are lots of people here gam yat jou mat yeh? today what (are we) doing? O gamyat heui wanchai lo yeh - today I am going to Wanchai to get something fankei chao dan - fried egg and tomato o tong lei heui wanchai - I'm going to Wanchai with you tong - with tong mai - and also lei hou lehng loi tong mai hou yao chin - you are beautiful and also have lots of money lei hou lehng hou gou - you are beautiful and tall chit mok - programme bo lei - glass seung - photo seung hai dai lok yeng geh - photo taken in the mainland hai m'hai lei yeng - did you take it? o dei dap dek si heui bindo ah? - where are we taking the taxi? o dei yi ga dap dek si heui sam hou matau - we are taking the taxi to pier number 3 hou chong - very heavy hai heung gong mai geh - is bought in Hong Kong hai lido jou geh - it's made here dek si hai bindou ah? - where are the taxis? m'heui bindou - I'm not going anywhere o heui bak geng - I'm going to Beijing gin pang yau min - to see my friend('s face) hou dong - very cold gei do dou - what temperature? Gung hei fat choi - Happy (Chinese) New Year Lai see doi loi - give me lai see (red money packets) fat mong mou gam jou - Dream on

Sick
M’hou – not good
O hou m’syu fok – I’m not well
Syu fok – comfortable
O yao di m' su fok – I’m not very well
Yao di – a little bit
Seung fong – cold flu

Fat siu – fever

Hou sai lei – very powerful

Tuen gwat – break a bone

Min – face

item.title: Lesson 104: New Year's Eve
item.itunes:author: Radio Television Hong Kong
item.itunes:subtitle: O hou hoi sam gin dou lei woh - I am very happy to see you today dai yat: hou loi mou gin - first (of all) long time no see dai yi: lei hou leeng loi - secondly you are a pretty girl fei sek - brown ga fei - coffee ga fei sat - coffee shop hou so - very silly sek seh - "eat snake" (have afternoon tea and chat) hou tsaam - really tragic/sad o hou tou yim - I am disgusted/sick (of it) o hou tou yim gong go di yeh - I am so sick of talking about these things tengyat yi ling ling gau lin - tomorrow is 2009 gamyat yi ling ling baht lin - today is 2008 lei gam man heui bindo ah? jou mat yeh? - tonight where are you going? what are you doing?
